XMLTool Namespace Reference

Contains usefull templated tools for reading and manipulating XML documents. More...

Classes

  • class XMLTool::DataBufferInputStream
    Creates a DataBuffer stream as input stream for xml parsers. More...
  • class XMLTool::XMLInit
    Helper class for initialize and terminate XMLPlatformUtils. More...
  • class XMLTool::NodeIterator< Type, PtrType >
    Simple node iterator for specific node types For an iterator that iterates through nodes of element type and returns const DOMNode pointer: 
     NodeIterator<DOMNode::ELEMENT_NODE, const DOMNode> it( node );
 NodeIterator<DOMNode::ELEMENT_NODE, const DOMNode> end( NULL );
 for ( ; it != end; ++it ) {
    cerr << it->getNodeName() << endl;
 }
    This is cleaner than the xerces implementation with filter and dom iterator. More...
  • class XMLTool::Exception
    exception thrown by XMLTool functions More...
  • class XMLTool::URLInputSource
    Generates input streams from an URL string. More...

Detailed Description

Contains usefull templated tools for reading and manipulating XML documents.

const char *  name,
const T &  value
) 
 

adds a attrib with a generic type, the type is converted in the specialized template.

Basic types like int32 and MC2String are declared in the .cpp file

Parameters:
node the element for which the new attrib should be inserted
name the name of the attribute
value the value of the attribute

template<typename T>
void getAttrib (  T &  dest,
const char *  attribName,
const DOMNode *  node,
const T &  defaultValue
)  throw ()
 

Tries to set dest from attrib value, if it fails it will set the default value.

This function does not throw.

Parameters:
dest destination variable
attribName the name of the attribute
node the node to get the value from
defaultValue the default value to set dest if attribName was not found

template<typename T>
bool getAttribValue (  T &  attribValue,
const char *  attribName,
const DOMNode *  node
)  throw ()
 

Sets attribValue to string value and returns true on success, else false if attribName does not exists.

Parameters:
attribValue the string value of the attribute
attribName name of the attribute in the node
node the node that should contain the attrib
Returns:
true if attribName was found else false. If return is false, the attribValue is unassigned.

Definition at line 258 of file XMLTool.h.

References getNodeValue().

MC2String getNodeValue (  const DOMNode *  root,
const MC2String &  defaultValue = MC2String()
) 
 

Return the content of the child node of root.

If there is no child node or if the child node is not a TEXT_NODE the defaultValue will be returned instead.

Parameters:
root The node.
defaultValue The default value.
Returns:
The node content.

Referenced by getElementValue(), and getNodeValue().

template<typename T>
T getNodeValue (  const DOMNode *  root,
const T &  defaultValue = T()
) 
 

Returns the text value of a node containing text.

The text is converted to the type specified by the template argument. If the node has no child node , if the child node is anything except a TEXT_NODE, or if there is problem in the conversion to the template type the default value will be returned.

Parameters:
root The node that should contain text.
defaultValue The backup return value.
Returns:
The converted value of the node content.

Definition at line 312 of file XMLTool.h.

References getTrimmedNodeValue().

template<typename T>
void getNodeValue (  T &  dest,
const char *  nodeName,
const DOMNode *  root,
const T &  defaultValue
)  throw ()
 

Sets dest to value of node, if node is not found or conversion failed the defaultValue will be used.

This function uses StringConvert::assign to convert value from string.

Parameters:
dest type specific value to be set
nodeName the name of the node
root the root node that should contain the named node.
defaultValue the value to set if normal getNodeValue failed.
